n archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Noah Levitt <nlevitt@...> wrote:
>
> Hel=
lo Matteo,
> 
> The UriUniqFilter of which BloomUriUniqFilter is an impleme=
ntation is used
> to prevent uris from being queued, processed and fetched =
repeatedly. If I'm
> not mistaken, if you were to exclude dns urls then the=
y would be crawled
> over and over again. So for good reason there's no fac=
ility for that in
> heritrix.
> 
> Noah
> 
> 
> On Mon, Mar 4, 2013 at 6:39=
 AM, matteo.ceccarello@... <
> matteo.ceccarello@...> wrote:
> 
> > Hi all!=

> >
> > My team and I are performing a large crawl and we are using a Bloo=
m filter
> > to keep track of the already visited nodes. One thing we didn'=
t expect was
> > that the filter keeps track of the URIs of the DNS protoco=
l, am I right?
> >
> > So we were expecting something on the order of 900 m=
illion nodes and,
> > after having crawled 400 millions we found out that o=
ur frontier, summing
> > up already downloaded and queued ones, contained m=
ore than a billion nodes!
> > So now the false positive probability is fall=
ing.
> >
> > Is there a way to prevent DNS URIs from being stored in the Bl=
oom filter?
> >
> > Thank you very much
> > Matteo
> >
> >
